attributes.name: amount
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional currency. No multicurrency translation should need to be performed on this amount because all transactions should be recorded in a single currency. Must be absolute.

attributes.name: amountCreditDebitIndicator
attributes.description: Indicates whether the amount is a credit or debit. 'C'=credit; 'D'=debit.

attributes.name: amountCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the functional currency of the entity, e.g. EUR for Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: approvedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who approved the entry.

attributes.name: approvedDateTime
attributes.description: The date and time the entry was approved.

attributes.name: businessUnitCode
attributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, etc. at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

attributes.name: clearingDate
attributes.description: The date on which the transaction was cleared.

attributes.name: clearingDocumentNumber
attributes.description: Document number of the cleaning document.

attributes.name: customerId
attributes.description: Unique code for the customer. Must match customerId per the customerMasterData.

attributes.name: documentDate
attributes.description: The date of the supporting document which forms the basis of the record e.g. supply invoice, credit note, etc.

attributes.name: documentStatus
attributes.description: Status of the transaction document, e.g. "Posted" or "Unposted".

attributes.name: documentType
attributes.description: Type of document which forms the basis of the record, e.g. supply invoice, credit note, etc.

attributes.name: effectiveDate
attributes.description: The date the transaction is effective.

attributes.name: enteredBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who created the record.

attributes.name: enteredDateTime
attributes.description: The date the transaction was entered into the system. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date. This should be a system-generated date (rather than user-entered date), when possible. This date does not necessarily correspond with the date of the transaction itself.

attributes.name: fiscalYear
attributes.description: Fiscal year in which effectiveDate occurs

attributes.name: glAccountNumber
attributes.description: Identifier for the account to which the transaction was posted. glAccountNumber in this file must match the glAccountNumber used in the trialBalance and chartOfAccounts

attributes.name: isClearing
attributes.description: TRUE/FALSE field indicating whether the transaction is a clearing transaction.

attributes.name: isInterCoFlag
attributes.description: TRUE/FALSE field indicating whether the transaction is intercompany.

attributes.name: isNegativePostingIndicator
attributes.description: TRUE/FALSE field indicating whether the transaction is a negative posting.

attributes.name: jeHeaderDescription
attributes.description: Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.

attributes.name: jeLineDescription
attributes.description: Description of the individual line within the journal entry.

attributes.name: journalEntryType
attributes.description: Types of journal entry recorded in the GL, e.g. Opening Entries, Transfer Entries, Closing Entries, Adjusting Entries, Compound Entries, and Reversing Entries.

attributes.name: journalId
attributes.description: Identifier that is unique for each journal entry. May require concatenation of multiple fields.

attributes.name: journalIdLineNumber
attributes.description: Identifier that is unique for each line within a journal entry.

attributes.name: lastModifiedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for the last person modifying this entry.

attributes.name: lastModifiedDate
attributes.description: The date the entry was last modified before posting.

attributes.name: localAmount
attributes.description: Amount of the transaction in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: localAmountCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: period
attributes.description: Fiscal period in which the effectiveDate occurs, e.g. W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, and Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods.

attributes.name: postingKey
attributes.description: Key identifying posting status or other posting information about the transaction.

attributes.name: referenceSubledgerDocumentNumber
attributes.description: Reference number associated with the subledger document which forms the basis of the record.

attributes.name: referenceTransaction
attributes.description: Reference number associated with other transaction related to the selected transaction, e.g. transactionId for sale transaction associated with a payment transaction.

attributes.name: reportingAmount
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the reporting currency.

attributes.name: reportingAmountCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 for the currency in which a reporting entity prepares its financial statements, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: reversalFiscalYear
attributes.description: Fiscal year in which the reversal is effective.

attributes.name: reversalIndicator
attributes.description: Indicates whether this entry is a reversal.

attributes.name: reversalJournalId
attributes.description: This identifies the journalId of the entry being reversed.

attributes.name: reversalReason
attributes.description: Reason for reversing the transaction.

attributes.name: reversalType
attributes.description: Code or name for the type of reversal, e.g. error, clearing, etc.

attributes.name: segment01
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment02
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment03
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment04
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment05
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: sourceId
attributes.description: Posting source: code for source from which the journal entry originated, e.g. sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, spreadsheet, etc.

attributes.name: supplierId
attributes.description: Identifier of the supplier to whom payment is due. Must match the supplierId in the supplierMasterData.

attributes.name: tags
attributes.description: Internal flags used to 'tag' GL transactions as belonging to specific categories.

attributes.name: taxCode
attributes.description: Code used to identify taxes relevant to the transaction.

attributes.name: transactionId
attributes.description: Cross-reference to GL posting. It can contain many different levels to identify the transaction. It could include cost centres such as company, division, region, group, branch, department, etc.

attributes.name: transactionType
attributes.description: Code or name for the type of transaction e.g. AP, AR, Fixed Asset Purchase, Credit Note, etc.

attributes.name: transactionTypeDescription
attributes.description: Longer-form description for the type of transaction.

attributes.name: userDefined1
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: userDefined2
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.
